Body:
I am not sure if the post really is about tag questions. I apologize for the confusion.

Now consider the following situation in English. Your friend asks you,

Haven't you had lunch?

If you haven't, you would say "no", because in English people answer according to the truth of the situation. In Chinese, however, people would say "yes", since they agree with the friend that they haven't had lunch.

Now I am wondering whether this difference is prevalent and where it came from. Also, since it is not a tag question, what is the right term here?

EDIT

I came across "rhetorical question" and "negative question" on Wikipedia as well but was not sure what exactly those two terms meant. I knew it wasn't a tag question but used the term nevertheless because tag question works the same way.
Title: Answering Tag Questions
